title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: We pass on without any stop through this town and go on to another part of my Lord's estate called Sharperton lying upon the river Coeute : through which we cross over to see a very large spring on the other side of it called Haliwell, and the town it belongs to, Halystane, where formerly was a Nunnery, and probably some Holy stone, as w6ll as a Holy well, which the good ladies might have some peculiar reverence for.
